subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: I just want to say...
author: April Abercrombie
full_text:
------=_NextPart_000_0297_01CA2197.C6A52350
Content-Type: text/plain;
	charset="iso-8859-1"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

Yeah...I will only comment if someone asks me to listen, an then I just tel=
l them what I hear. I keep my judgments to myself about if I think it is ac=
tual communication or not. That is unless they ask for my opinion.



  ---=
-- Original Message ----- 
  From: Misty Dawn 
  To: EVP-ITC@...=
m 
  Sent: Thursday, August 20, 2009 12:31 PM
  Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: =
I just want to say...


    Yep April you are right. Remaining open to the =
possibility is hard enough for most people. Again its a case of prove or di=
sprove it for yourself. Not everyone comes to the same conclusions or gets =
the exact same results. Maybe similar but not exact. 

        I tend to us=
e a variety of methods. When voices come from things such as water or out o=
f thin air sometimes its a easier for some to believe there is something th=
ere that they were not aware of.

        But again they have to prove it f=
or themselves to be able to have that eye opening moment.

        I only c=
omment on what I hear or dont hear. My speaker set up is a bit different th=
an most. I hate headphones. Others prefer them. Some use pc speakers. Resul=
ts vary based on the individual. What I hear you may not then again you jus=
t might hear it exactly the same. I dont worry about that. Just keep explor=
ing with an open mind.

        Misty




        --- On Thu, 8/20/09, Apri=
l Abercrombie <april@...> wrote:


          From:=
 April Abercrombie <april@...>
          Subject: =
Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: I just want to say...
          To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.c=
om
          Date: Thursday, August 20, 2009, 10:01 AM


            
     =
     To be honest, I am still very skeptical about the Frank's Box type of =
technology, as I have not heard anything convincing enough for me personall=
y to say yeah-that is spirit communication. But I do remain open to the pos=
sibility.

          But that is my problem not anyone else's, and this is =
why I have refrained from commenting too much on anyone's results.

       =
     ----- Original Message ----- 
            From: bulletbabea 
         =
   To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups .com 
            Sent: Wednesday, August 19, 20=
09 8:32 PM
            Subject: [EVP-ITC] Re: I just want to say...


     =
         
            I think it varies depending on who you ask as well as=
 what they have personally experienced. As an example, some people believe =
in angels and demons others do not. Therefor some may get messages that cor=
respond to their own beliefs as well as the beliefs of those who are speaki=
ng.

            Almost every person who does this eventually develops a th=
eory that may change over time based on what they experience and what their=
 beliefs are. Then there are those who remain undecided or have doubts.

  =
          As for me I look at it as purely educational, a learning experien=
ce. Ive met many people I never knew existed. Ive researched topics I'd nev=
er even considered. Ive gotten messages and images that are awe inspiring a=
nd many interesting concepts to ponder and explore.

            There are =
many glimpses of truth, as well as momentary proof along the way that lead =
me to develop my own theory and eventually you will develop your own too. T=
his research is fascinating and can be quite mind blowing.

            I d=
ont worry what anyone else thinks. I have no need to prove anything to anyo=
ne else. They can do that for themselves. I always say honesty is the best =
policy and if you are honest with yourself and others the only ones who obj=
ect are those who's lies arent tolerated. So just look for the truth yourse=
lf and dont let me or anyone else tell you what that is. 

            It's=
 a great journey and your path is your own!

            Misty

           =
 --- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups .com, "mrscaptainjack2" <jjkamp@...> wrote:
   =
         >
            > Thank you, guys, but I just wanted to make sure --=
 really sure. Sometimes it's hard on here to figure out which post is reply=
ing to which!
            > 
            > So I've been thinking about this=
 over and over -- I've been able to think of little else in the last few da=
ys -- trying to figure this out and make some sort of reasonable theory I c=
an live with. I know we will never have a true answer, at least not any tim=
e soon, but surely those who have been doing this for years and years must =
have a working theory on what these entities are? Based on their behavior r=
ather than what they say? Based on consistencies from researcher to researc=
her? Based on things these entities know and don't know (e.g. knew my dad's=
 friend Gordy was dead, while I did not)?
            >
